conclusion: Understanding the concept of total internal reflection (TIR) and its relation to refractive index.
TIR occurs when light travels from a medium with a higher refractive index to a lower one, exceeding the critical angle.
The critical angle formula is given by sin(θc) = n2/n1, where n1 is the refractive index of the initial medium and n2 of the second medium.
Identifying the critical angle as 41 degrees since the laser is received only when α > 41.
Setting θc = 41° based on the problem statement.
The refractive index of air (n2) is approximately 1.
Substituting into the critical angle formula: sin(41°) = 1/n1.
Rearranging to solve for n1: n1 = 1/sin(41°) ≈ 1.52.
The refractive index of water is approximately 1.52.
